channel.title: RS.EVAi
channel.description:
[img]http://rsevai.com/resources/images/body-title.png[/img] [hr]
[size=14pt]More information is coming soon, I rushed this. Hold onto your butts.[/size] [hr]
[b]Website:[/b] http://rsevai.com/ [b]Social Twitter:[/b] http://twitter.com/rsevai [b]Social Facebook:[/b] http://www.facebook.com/pages/RSEVAi/121739024597972 [i]Disclaimer:[/i] Verified by Davidi2 [hr]
[b]Objective:[/b] Our objective is to create a java based server application with a scripting system, designed to host a fully capable RuneScape private server. Once the core is complete, we will create content and host the server for players to enjoy. After a year, we will release the source code in full. [hr]
[b]Information:[/b] Base: RS.EVAi Core Revision: / not yet decided, help us decide / Server Type: / not yet relevant / [hr]
[b]Game Server:[/b] |||||||||||||||||||| [i]Description:[/i] The game server's main purpose is to act as a single world and deliver playable content to players. [i]Progress:[/i]
[ul][li]Scripting[/li] [list] [li]Java[/li] [li]Lua[/li] [/list] [li]Event Manager[/li] [list] [li]Entity[/li] [li]LivingEntity[/li] [li]Player[/li] [list] [li]Player Join Event[/li] [li]Player Quit Event[/li] [li]...[/li] [/list] [li]Npc[/li] [/list] [li]Entity Manager[/li] [list] [li]Entity[/li] [list] [li]Location[/li] [/list] [li]LivingEntity[/li] [list] [li]Combat[/li] [li]UpdateFlags[/li] [li]Movement[/li] [/list] [li]Player[/li] [list] [li]Gfx[/li] [li]Animation[/li] [li]Chatting[/li] [li]Skilling[/li] [li]Inventory[/li] [li]Equipment[/li] [li]Banking[/li] [li]Permissions[/li] [li]...[/li] [/list] [li]Npc[/li] [list] [li]...[/li] [/list] [li]MapObject[/li] [li]GroundItem[/li] [list] [li]Ownership[/li] [li]Disappearing[/li] [/list] [/list][/ul]
[b]Login Server:[/b] |||||||||||||||||||| [i]Description:[/i] The login server's main purpose is to record the currently logged in players on each server for the use of friends lists and other game mechanics. It is also in charge of saving and loading players. [i]Progress:[/i]
[ul][li]Server Login[/li] [li]Server Requests[/li] [list] [li]Player Login[/li] [li]Player Logout[/li] [li]Player Save[/li] [list] [li]Organized Data[/li] [/list] [li]Player Load[/li] [/list] [li]Server Communication[/li] [list] [li]...[/li] [/list] [li]Json Requests[/li][/ul]
[b]Ondemand Server:[/b] |||||||||||||||||||| We have not yet started this section.
[b]JagGrab Server:[/b] |||||||||||||||||||| We have created the class file for this, however it does not currently do anything.
[b]Content Concept:[/b] |||||||||||||||||||| [i]Description:[/i] A before-ready concept of what the server will be like when it is done on a less qualified base such as Delta. Bugs are irrelevant, the idea is all that matters. [i]Progress:[/i] / pending /
[b]Scripted Content:[/b] [i]Description:[/i] The scripted content that will be used in the hosted server. [i]Progress:[/i] / not yet relevant /
[b]Client Development:[/b] [i]Description:[/i] A simple client that we will refactor and tweak to fit our needs, while keeping it as close to the deob as possible. [i]Progress:[/i] / not yet relevant / [hr]
[b]Media:[/b] [i]Server Packaging:[/i] http://gyazo.com/9b0970ab3188c470fee52936e398e547.png [hr]
[b]Release:[/b] I will host this server on a linux box for about a year to tweak it and test it's limits, hopefully it being successful, and then release it in full. I want to release a fully capable server, after all. [hr]
[b]Help Us:[/b] We need your opinions to make this possible. You can tell us any of your opinions or ideas, and we will take it into very close consideration. We care about your opinions. [hr]
[b]Last Thoughts:[/b] [i]Coelho:[/i] I've been asked to host another server for quite a while now, and have entirely ignored my requests due to the fact I do not want to host something I did not create. I see too many people taking a good server, and ruining it. All the compliments related to their submission just seem naive to me, because when it looks on the outside they made the server better, on the inside they just made it a whole lot worse. I can't tell how many times I've seen someone take a good server, and ruin it. A scripting system with boundaries and limits can somewhat prevent this. [i]Own_:[/i] / pending / [hr]
[b]Credits:[/b]
[ul][li]Coelho[/li] [li]Own_[/li][/ul]

@sinisoul wrote:

I’d like to work on other parts of the server before I implement Lua, but I assure that Lua will be implemented.

Haha! Good. Be sure to design a good ‘environment’ system or else it will be hard to work with.

item.title: RS.EVAi
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:14, topic:418599”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=521134.msg3787734#msg3787734 date=1319031596]
It totally looks oft for what I think a scripting language usually consists of, OP could use Rhino and succeed in the same thing or as you suggested: use Lua or Ruby. I don’t believe Java was really ‘designed’ for this purpose, although it could function as a scripting medium.
[/quote]You’re completely right. I’ve played around with Java as a scripting language and it is horrible. Personally I prefer Ruby; but each to their own.[/quote]

I have used Ruby a couple of times but I love Lua so when I usually have to use a scripting language API in java, I use LuaJava even though I have to tweak a couple things so my environments suit me better. I was thinking the other day that it wouldn’t be that much of a challenge just to make a linked library with the sole purpose of handling Ruby/Lua commands since all the source files for handling the two scripting languages come with the source release. Although there may be some nice packages out there for handling Ruby and Lua in Java, I would find it interesting to just see someone try. Oh forgot to mention S1gma showed me an example once of Cloture, I was impressed with the simplicity of it.

As for this project so that we don’t get to far off topic, OP I really suggest looking into the things we are talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: RS.EVAi
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:13, topic:418599”]It totally looks oft for what I think a scripting language usually consists of, OP could use Rhino and succeed in the same thing or as you suggested: use Lua or Ruby. I don’t believe Java was really ‘designed’ for this purpose, although it could function as a scripting medium.[/quote]You’re completely right. I’ve played around with Java as a scripting language and it is horrible. Personally I prefer Ruby; but each to their own.

Read full topic

item.title: RS.EVAi
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:12, topic:418599”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=521134.msg3787063#msg3787063 date=1318975016]

Scripting in Java?

Example (Welcome.java):

import com.rsevai.game.event.Event;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerListener;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerQuitEvent;
import com.rsevai.game.script.Script;

public class Welcome extends Script implements PlayerListener {
	
	@Override
	public void onEnable() {
		this.getServer().getEventManager().register(this, Event.Type.PLAYER_JOIN);
		this.getServer().getEventManager().register(this, Event.Type.PLAYER_QUIT);
		System.out.println("[Welcome] started.");
	}

	@Override
	public void onDisable() {
		System.out.println("[Welcome] stopped.");
	}

	public void onPlayerJoin(PlayerJoinEvent event) {
		System.out.println(event.getPlayer().getUsername() + " has joined!");
		event.getPlayer().getActionSender().sendMessage("Welcome!");
	}

	public void onPlayerQuit(PlayerQuitEvent event) {
		System.out.println(event.getPlayer().getUsername() + " has quit! What a shame!");	
	}

}

I’ll implement other script loaders later, but at the moment, java is the simplest.
[/quote]Do the Java scripts act like proper scripts though? Can they be reloaded, have their variables read (without having to import the script into the engine) and have invocable methods that can be called from the engine? If not look read below.

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=521134.msg3786748#msg3786748 date=1318950495]
Scripting in Java?
[/quote]http://blogs.oracle.com/sundararajan/entry/jsr_223_script_engine_for

It’s an implementation of the javax.script.ScriptEngine for using Java as a scripting language. It’s a cool idea but Java isn’t really a good candidate when you look at Lua or Ruby.[/quote]

It totally looks oft for what I think a scripting language usually consists of, OP could use Rhino and succeed in the same thing or as you suggested: use Lua or Ruby. I don’t believe Java was really ‘designed’ for this purpose, although it could function as a scripting medium.

Read full topic

item.title: RS.EVAi
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:11, topic:418599”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=521134.msg3786748#msg3786748 date=1318950495]
Scripting in Java?
[/quote]
Example (Welcome.java):

import com.rsevai.game.event.Event;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerListener;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerQuitEvent;
import com.rsevai.game.script.Script;

public class Welcome extends Script implements PlayerListener {
	
	@Override
	public void onEnable() {
		this.getServer().getEventManager().register(this, Event.Type.PLAYER_JOIN);
		this.getServer().getEventManager().register(this, Event.Type.PLAYER_QUIT);
		System.out.println("[Welcome] started.");
	}

	@Override
	public void onDisable() {
		System.out.println("[Welcome] stopped.");
	}

	public void onPlayerJoin(PlayerJoinEvent event) {
		System.out.println(event.getPlayer().getUsername() + " has joined!");
		event.getPlayer().getActionSender().sendMessage("Welcome!");
	}

	public void onPlayerQuit(PlayerQuitEvent event) {
		System.out.println(event.getPlayer().getUsername() + " has quit! What a shame!");	
	}

}

I’ll implement other script loaders later, but at the moment, java is the simplest.[/quote]Do the Java scripts act like proper scripts though? Can they be reloaded, have their variables read (without having to import the script into the engine) and have invocable methods that can be called from the engine? If not look read below.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:9, topic:418599”]Scripting in Java?[/quote]http://blogs.oracle.com/sundararajan/entry/jsr_223_script_engine_for

It’s an implementation of the javax.script.ScriptEngine for using Java as a scripting language. It’s a cool idea but Java isn’t really a good candidate when you look at Lua or Ruby.

Read full topic

item.title: RS.EVAi
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

sinisoul:

Scripting in Java?

Example (Welcome.java):

import com.rsevai.game.event.Event;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerJoinEvent;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerListener;
import com.rsevai.game.event.player.PlayerQuitEvent;
import com.rsevai.game.script.Script;

public class Welcome extends Script implements PlayerListener {
	
	@Override
	public void onEnable() {
		this.getServer().getEventManager().register(this, Event.Type.PLAYER_JOIN);
		this.getServer().getEventManager().register(this, Event.Type.PLAYER_QUIT);
		System.out.println("[Welcome] started.");
	}

	@Override
	public void onDisable() {
		System.out.println("[Welcome] stopped.");
	}

	public void onPlayerJoin(PlayerJoinEvent event) {
		System.out.println(event.getPlayer().getUsername() + " has joined!");
		event.getPlayer().getActionSender().sendMessage("Welcome!");
	}

	public void onPlayerQuit(PlayerQuitEvent event) {
		System.out.println(event.getPlayer().getUsername() + " has quit! What a shame!");	
	}

}

I’ll implement other script loaders later, but at the moment, java is the simplest.

Read full topic

item.title: RS.EVAi
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:


[hr]

[size=14pt]More information is coming soon, I rushed this. Hold onto your butts.[/size]
[hr]

Website: http://rsevai.com/
Social Twitter: http://twitter.com/rsevai
Social Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/RSEVAi/121739024597972
Disclaimer: Verified by Davidi2
[hr]

Objective:
Our objective is to create a java based server application with a scripting system, designed to host a fully capable RuneScape private server. Once the core is complete, we will create content and host the server for players to enjoy. After a year, we will release the source code in full.
[hr]

Information:
Base: RS.EVAi Core
Revision: / not yet decided, help us decide /
Server Type: / not yet relevant /
[hr]

Game Server: ||||||||||||||||||||
Description: The game server’s main purpose is to act as a single world and deliver playable content to players.
Progress:

[ul][li]Scripting[/li]
[list]
[li]Java[/li]
[li]Lua[/li]
[/list]
[li]Event Manager[/li]
[list]
[li]Entity[/li]
[li]LivingEntity[/li]
[li]Player[/li]
[list]
[li]Player Join Event[/li]
[li]Player Quit Event[/li]
[li]…[/li]
[/list]
[li]Npc[/li]
[/list]
[li]Entity Manager[/li]
[list]
[li]Entity[/li]
[list]
[li]Location[/li]
[/list]
[li]LivingEntity[/li]
[list]
[li]Combat[/li]
[li]UpdateFlags[/li]
[li]Movement[/li]
[/list]
[li]Player[/li]
[list]
[li]Gfx[/li]
[li]Animation[/li]
[li]Chatting[/li]
[li]Skilling[/li]
[li]Inventory[/li]
[li]Equipment[/li]
[li]Banking[/li]
[li]Permissions[/li]
[li]…[/li]
[/list]
[li]Npc[/li]
[list]
[li]…[/li]
[/list]
[li]MapObject[/li]
[li]GroundItem[/li]
[list]
[li]Ownership[/li]
[li]Disappearing[/li]
[/list]
[/list][/ul]

Login Server: ||||||||||||||||||||
Description: The login server’s main purpose is to record the currently logged in players on each server for the use of friends lists and other game mechanics. It is also in charge of saving and loading players.
Progress:

[ul][li]Server Login[/li]
[li]Server Requests[/li]
[list]
[li]Player Login[/li]
[li]Player Logout[/li]
[li]Player Save[/li]
[list]
[li]Organized Data[/li]
[/list]
[li]Player Load[/li]
[/list]
[li]Server Communication[/li]
[list]
[li]…[/li]
[/list]
[li]Json Requests[/li][/ul]

Ondemand Server: ||||||||||||||||||||
We have not yet started this section.

JagGrab Server: ||||||||||||||||||||
We have created the class file for this, however it does not currently do anything.

Content Concept: ||||||||||||||||||||
Description: A before-ready concept of what the server will be like when it is done on a less qualified base such as Delta. Bugs are irrelevant, the idea is all that matters.
Progress: / pending /

Scripted Content:
Description: The scripted content that will be used in the hosted server.
Progress: / not yet relevant /

Client Development:
Description: A simple client that we will refactor and tweak to fit our needs, while keeping it as close to the deob as possible.
Progress: / not yet relevant /
[hr]

Media:
Server Packaging: http://gyazo.com/9b0970ab3188c470fee52936e398e547.png
[hr]

Release:
I will host this server on a linux box for about a year to tweak it and test it’s limits, hopefully it being successful, and then release it in full. I want to release a fully capable server, after all.
[hr]

Help Us:
We need your opinions to make this possible. You can tell us any of your opinions or ideas, and we will take it into very close consideration. We care about your opinions.
[hr]

Last Thoughts:
Coelho: I’ve been asked to host another server for quite a while now, and have entirely ignored my requests due to the fact I do not want to host something I did not create. I see too many people taking a good server, and ruining it. All the compliments related to their submission just seem naive to me, because when it looks on the outside they made the server better, on the inside they just made it a whole lot worse. I can’t tell how many times I’ve seen someone take a good server, and ruin it. A scripting system with boundaries and limits can somewhat prevent this.
Own_: / pending /
[hr]

Credits:

[ul][li]Coelho[/li]
[li]Own_[/li][/ul]

Read full topic
